The only downside being is that the story is just thrown in and you wont remember it.Follow us here Steamship Discord: https://discord.gg/XbsKrtKSteamship Steam group: http://steamcommunity.com/groups/thesteamshipPros  Huge explorable mapsSatisfying explosionsHuge variety in vehiclesFilled with entertaining events Cons Very weak storyPoor quality cutscenes---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- GameplayWith just the grappling hook there are so many ways that you can cause chaos all over Panau. The game world is your playground with a near endless amount of destruction to be caused, there is no real punishment for attacking anyone but attacking the military is a better idea because the send reinforcements to be played with. Even though driving is slower than just grappling around all vehicles control so well and can be used in interesting ways to destroy the environment. StoryThe story is the weakest part of just cause because of how little it matters, While having some amusing references to real world politics. Characters The character in just cause are just stereotypical of certain culture and none of them seem to care about the destruction you bring with you. Every single time you interact with an npc to start a mission they basically always ask you to blow everything up till you win. Art/Graphics The massive map gives a plethora of beautiful environments, everything you can see on the map you can explore and there are many secrets to find. The world feels very natural as they mix purely natural areas and a few miles away there are military districts and towns. The games color pallet is never dull even in rain storms there are bright mixes of colors that look amazing.Bonus Notes The games DLCs are just things that max the game more silly and would agree getting them if they are in a bundle. Just cause 2 is one of the best open world games and will give hours of entertainment.If you like this join us here to get the latest Reviews:Steamship Discord: https://discord.gg/XbsKrtKSteamship Steam group : http://steamcommunity.com/groups/thesteamshipWhat would you like to see for our next review ? 												There are a lot of improvements from his antecesor.The driving it's stable, but you still can't shoot your weapons from any vehicle while the others still can. It's true that the police it's able to shoot you from their cars because it's the passenger that does it. But the ones that drives the motorcycle doesn't have passengers and they still can shoot you while driving. But now you don't drive very often since you have a better way of transportation: Your grappling hook and parachute. They have created the best way to travel around the island. By just grappling something and opening your parachute you can go faster than a car and you don't need to worry about what is ahead of you. The only thing that is better than this it's just the helicopters and jets. The helicopters because you can attack your enemies more efficiently and the jets because you can travel the island faster. You can also climb with it and it makes running and walking very obsolete. It's like the whip in Super Castlevania IV. You can do everything with it and it makes everything more easy for you to do.The shooting system has been improved too. The ability of using 2 single handled weapons can make you clean an area very fast. Rocket launchers are useful now that you can have more ammo with it.Enemy helicopters are more forgiving now that they don't spam you with rockets every time you are on a vehicle. They are still a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥ but it's a balanced pain.The missions are entertaining and if you fail it's because it was your fault, not theirs. But I hate that sometimes they tell you what you have to do after wandering in circles while everyone shoots you.The multiplayer mod it's just that. You and a bunch of players in one big island as a playground. Some servers let you join a team, play custom missions, or just be a free for all where you all fight in the rave club because why not.I recommend buying it with the Just Cause Collection. It comes with the DLC and the first Just Cause. So you can also experience how bad it's the prequel by itself and in comparison with this one.

content:
Posted: February 12, 2014
												Not to sure where to start with this game, because to begin with I was a little sceptical, and saw this game as a cheap rip-off of GTA and FarCry combined.Oh how wrong I was. Now I don't know where to start, as the game, put simply is incredible.First things first; maybe people will be quick to tell you the story is rather short lived, and the side missions drag a bit. While some might say this, in my current clocked gametime (about 15 hours I believe) I have completed a mere 9% of the game. I haven't been powering though the story, but why would you want to? This game is so beautiful and detailed that you can easily spend hours wandering the mountains and villages, basejumping from the skyscrapers in the financial district, hijacking aeroplanes and helicopters from the various island airports, racing fast cars down huge open motorways, racing slow cars off the sides of the mountain tops and darting through settlements at high speeds using your grappling hook.And that's just stuff you can do before you unlock anything in the game through story missions or side quest rewards.The graphics in this game are breath-taking, and the detail and thought throughout the island of Panau is simply remarkable. Add into all of this the reality physics engines (and the odd ragdoll moments, of course!) and the unlimited replayablity of this game, then even if you do decide to power-storm the story and rampage towards the 100% mark (which might seem hard at first, but a clever in game tracker allows you cheevo-freaks out there to hunt down every crate, drug drop, skull and blackbox) then even after this, you can safely assume you can quadruple your total gametime just playing about with everything this game has to offer.It is currently priced at £9.99, and for that much I can guarentee you will not find a better game to clock hundreds, if not into the thousands worth of game time.If it's on offer (really doesn't need to be, worth EVERY penny) and you don't pick this diamond up, you might as well just take your computer, climb a high mountain, chuck it off and at least give something the chance to experience the 'Just Cause 2' life.

content:
Posted: August 10, 2014
												Just Cause 2 isn't your average Third-Person Shooter game, it's a completely unique twist.  This game is all about HOOKS, GUNS, DIVES and DESTRUCTION.+ Satisfying Action.+ Plenty of variety among vehicles; - A little less in guns though.+ Controls are easy to learn and use.+ Grappling hook mechanism is really fun to use and very well implemented.+ Even though the game was released in 2010, the Graphics are pretty darn good.+ The MAP is HUGE and takes a lot of time to explore. It has lots of scenery, moutains, water bodies, objects, building and much more.+ Game provides a lot of freedom, which is hard to find by in recent titles.+ Game has full 360 Controller Support, but I prefer KB/M because of the precision aim required to land hooks in extremely bizzare ways :)- Story sucks. (This was a huge turnoff for me atleast.)- Most of the missions are exactly the same damn thing again and again. You will do the exact same thing just at a different place with different clothed allies.- Unless you like to destroy everything, attach objects with hook for no-reason and do crazy♥♥♥♥♥♥. you'll get bored easily.- Game has some stability issues and crashed 3 times on my PC in 3 hours of gameplay. - The saving feature sucks, sometimes it over-writes your manual save with auto-saves. It auto-saves when you die, so the last checkpoint during a long mission is usually somewhere near the start of the mission.A lot of my friends just absolutely adored this game because of the freedom, flexibility it provides. The game will also tolerate any crazy♥♥♥♥♥♥you want to do and you will have an amazing blast if you are that kind of a person.  But for me, I look more in a game. I look for immersiveness and the ability of the game to keep me interested in it at all times.Final Thoughts:I got the game for about $3-4 and it was well worth the price.  I'm going to 'RECOMMEND' this game if you can get it within $7.5 which really ins't hard since the game is 4 years old and goes on sale pretty often.

content:
Posted: January 4, 2011
												This should have been the gamers' game of the year. will start off from the very thing that got me hooked to this game.It's the map. This game has the second biggest game map ever created to date (I was told that FUEL has the biggest map which is 5,560 square miles)Just cause 2 map is 37 by 37 kilometers. A couple of kilometers on each side of the square map is water, so let's go by 35 by 35 kilometers. Multiply 35 by 35 and there you go - you have 1,225 square kilometers of map to explore, give or take 100 square kilometers.For the comparison, let's take the Fallout 3 map. That map is about 35 square kilometers.The Oblivion 4 map is roughly the same size.GTA 3 is 35-36 square kilometersGTA 4 is 15 square kilometersAnd I thought the Far Cry 2 map was huge. It's 50 square kilometers.The ARMA 2 map was definitely the biggest one before Just Cause 2 stepped in. The most important reason why i bought the disappointingly unoptimized ARMA 2 is to simply explore the roughly 400 square kilometers map.I remember wondering when I was younger if they would ever make a big enough map for a game which I could explore for days and days and days. I thought they finally did that with Arma 2, and despite the fact that I still could not play the game on maximum settings even when my rig should have easily taken on almost 2 ARMA 2's (According to the "recommended settings"), I still loved the fact that I could enjoy the country-side that I haven't been to in years.The second thing is that we ACTUALLY have directx 10 in this game. FINALLY, how many more directx 9 games are we going to have? We have directx 11 already, so what's the deal? The directx 10 pretty much seals the deal and completes the game map that I still cannot believe they made. I also cannot believe that the entire game fits on a DVD, how the HELL do they pull that off? shouldn't the map this size be at least 30 GB? I mean Age of Conan: Hyborian Adventure is like a 30-35 GB game.Well, the third thing is... Ah what the hell, you know the rest. Complete freedom of action, unrealistic stunts, the temporary to permanent abandonment of the laws of physics, infinite parachute, a hundred of drivable vehicles, a cute Easter egg, the Hatch from the first and second seasons of LOST, the pleasure of having to spend 20 minutes just to fly from one end of the map to another on a stolen government jet, the joy of swimming in the sea (wish they had sharks though), the eye candy explosions that you never get tired off, the realistic driving of the vehicles (aside from the way they rotate in mid air sometimes), the realistic damage to the PARTS OF THE VEHICLES THAT WERE ACTUALLY DAMAGED IN THE IMPACT, I could go on and on about this gameIm also playing this game on IMPOSSIBLE and find it quite easy to beat. You just move constantly, shoot (There is sadly a default auto-aim option enabled that you cannot disable) and press "tab" or whatever you have to evade bullets. HOWEVER, a nearby grenade explosion is almost guaranteed to kill you, so for MAXIMUM realism, I recommend playing this game on IMPOSSIBLEIm not gonna complain about the check point system, I love the checkpoint system. it makes games more challenging. Plus there still is a SAVE option, although it doesnt work in its original meaningThe story is blah. Who cares? Some of the missions that they give you though are somewhat original and a breath of fresh air from some of the repetitive GTA missions. However, most of those missions are, attack, kill, destroy, blow up, move on. It would have been nice if they added an element of stealth to the game though. It would feel great if could actually play as a somewhat silent or stealthy lethal saboteur. I would also like it if they imposed a penalty for killing civilians both on purpose and incidentally.I know this game won't win the game of the year award since there is no real substance I guess, but unofficially, this will probably be the gamer's choice No 1 game of 2010. (I hope Metro 2033 wins the game of the year though, which I rationally know it won't)This game is a pinnacle of guilty pleasure if I can say that. It absorbs so much of my time that I barely have enough time for myself, and its only my second-third day of playing the game. For the third day in the row I come to work late with blood-shot eyes. I actually prefer to staying home and playing this game all weekend and after that, instead of going out with my gf. That's how much impact this game had on me.If you are an extremely busy person with a busy schedule, i do not recommend playing this game until you find some time to kill, otherwise you'd get the plants vs zombies syndrome, where you cannot stop playing the game and start missing out on life. But I guess, now it's gonna be the Just cause 2 syndromeI don't want to get emo about this but I'll say honestly that it's actually games like these that make me sorta happy that I was born with enough luck and resources to actually play them, but I'm only speaking for myself here.Until then, the most rational case for you is to buy this game, support the developers and enjoy it fully until your eyes bleed and your brain melts, since forgetting about reality as much as possible should be the just cause of all gamers.

content:
Posted: November 21, 2015
												This game really surprised me in a lot of ways. In short, this game is a cross between GTA and Far Cry. If that interests you, please read on. If not, this game may not interest you.There's going to be quite a bit of negative, so bear with me.- The shooting and control mechanisms in this game are clearly made to be played on a console, or at least with a controller. There's aim assist, and there is no way to turn this off, and the enemies cannot hit me.- The text smoothing is horrific, and the menus look terrible. Images, too, are incredibly low resolution and even at 1920x1080 on max settings, all of the images and text looks blurry. Motion blur persists on my machine with each game restart for some odd reason, no matter how many times I turn it off and save those changes. - The amount of damage vehicles take is highly inconsistent as well; some cars cannot be destroyed no matter how hard I try; seriously, I tried! Some started smoking and falling apart only after a few bullets, and blow up with one grenade anywhere, while others can take any amoutn of fire and only blow up with a grenade under the engine. Also it is NOT POSSIBLE to shoot enemies through car windows or windshield; you need to get on top of a car and attempt to enter it with 'E', then enter a series of three integers ranging from 1-4. I do not know what happens if you fail to hit the correct buttons, since it's near impossible to mess it up.- No reprocussions come from just killing allies (friendly fire). In other similarly styled open-world yet linear games, the Far Cry franchise in particular, in the last two games there has been a karma system, and killing allies subtracts karma points which in turn affects the game's rank progression and unlockable missions and items. - I'm sure you can find a playthrough out there of someone only using the grappling hook as transportation/weapon. I'm serious, you can use this for everything; it takes 1-3 hits to kill someone with it from my experience, and has a huuge range. I f used correctly and on the right terrain, crossing over mountains to reach a destination can be nuch easier than driving on the designated routes.- The storyline is hilariously bad. This could be a positive for some people. I personally hate cutscenes and games which try to connect on a deeper level with the player. Fortunately, most of the cutscenes can be skipped, but not all. Dear lord, definitely not all.- The ususal gameplay bugs and glitches.Now for the positives.- The game has aim assist, the enemies are dumb, and they have a very low hit accuracy compared to other games. This is good because it allows the player to not worry about perfect cover and aiming accuracy, making it a great casual game to play when you are relaxing after a long work day. Sometimes you need to just run in to an enemy camp guns blazingand just kill some bad guys. This still does not excuse the lack of an option to turn this feature off.- Vehicles can take a large amount of damage before needing repairs. Driving is a lot of fun in this game because you can drive across all sorts of terrain, and have easy controls. Great for the same above reasons; fun casual gameplay.-The grappling hook is loads of fun to use. I still find it thrilling to flu through the air, hang off of helicopters, cliffs, etc. and I love to knock people off of their motorcycles or scare people by car surfing or taking over their vehicles. Overall I highly recommend this game for it's sheer casual gameplay and fun mechanics. for $15 this game is worth the price, and is a compelling buy for anyone who likes opwn world game with a linear storyline, like Far Cry, with the driving mechanics and modern city setting of GTA.

content:
Posted: November 25, 2013
												Just Cause 2 is the single best open world action title released to date. There is no other game that allows you to do anywhere near as much as this game does, no other title gives you such an enormous sense of freedom and satisfaction. The game is visually stunning and contains some of the most exciting and beautiful moments I have ever witnessed whilst playing.The gameplay system gives players a variety of ways in which to move around their world and explore the beautiful tropical island of Panau, starting the player of immediately with a grappling hook-parachute combo that is a fantastic innovation by square enix. You are able to slingshot yourself using your grapple hook and parachute in unision, paraglide of the back of a boat, or -if you purchase the DLC- you can fly around using your parachute thrusters which are fantastic. The hook is fast and precise and very fun once you learn to use it effectively; it also allows you to 'Dual hook' objects and entities together for some entertaining results.The story isn't great and the voice acting is horrible, but I almost wonder whether this is the game poking fun at action movies that often suffer these tropes, however this dosn't detract from the experience much as the missions themselves are greatly varied and interesting.The DLC is reasonably priced and well worth shelling out a few dollars for as they add some great new weapons and wehicles. I particularly favour the parachute thrusters and the Air Gun that fires compressed air to blast enemies and vehicles high into the sky!If you like open world games then this is definitely one to look at, I have played for over 100 hours and I'm ready for the next  100 (: so go on, buy the game!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 22, 2014
												I played Just Cause 2 on the XBox 360 for a couple of years and had a blast. I recently saw it on a Steam sale and realized I missed it, so decided to take a chance.And I'm so glad I did: the truly open-world, free-flowing, do-what-you-want nature of it is so refreshing after so many other games that promise an open world, but often come with clever, but limiting, obstacles to wide-ranging exploration. The vastness of the world is unlike anything I've played. Flying in the fastest jet still takes minutes to traverse the set of islands, and there are no loading screens or lag.It is an easy game to play for 20 minutes, or 20 hours. Do a long, involved Agency Mission or just grab a chopper and take down a few water tanks.It works well with my XBox 360 controller on Windows 7 64-bit and nVidia 660 GPU. It also works well with my 60-year-old fingers and eyesight.Like Borderlands and Fallout, a game I keep coming back to when I just want to wander around aimlessly and shoot something.

												While this game can deliver on your desire for open-world, free roam destruction and action, I was still left a bit disappointed. After playing a great mil-box title like Mercenaries, I was left wanting very soon after beginning JC2. Most if not all of the unlocks are a wank, the guns are vanilla and snoozy, there is little variation in the monotonous grind of blowing up targets for gold. Without an airstrike mechanic like in Mercenaries, there is little to keep me playing for more than an hour. If you're looking for a straight-forward, blow♥♥♥♥♥♥up experience, this will deliver. If you're looking for immersion and progression on par with late developer Pandemic's titles, look elsewhere. Pandemic just knew how to make military sandbox gameplay awesome. RIP to a great developer.SCORES:Action : 8Story : 6Unlocks : 2Replay : 5OVERALL : 6Buy on sale only. Im looking forward to potential improvements in JC3!

												I remeber watching Michal Bay movies on the weekends, and thinking if they combined the explosive, jumping out of planes fun from the movies, into a game, it would be totally kickass. Well, squarenix must have thought the same thing, because here they are, providing me with Just Cause 2. content:
Posted: December 9, 2010
												Just Cause 2 is a single player sandbox game that scores major points for being extremely fun to play while looking deliriously pretty in the process.  The game lets you drive tons of cars, motorcycles, trucks, boats, jets, helicopters, etc, but the base mechanic of flinging your grappling hook out and then launching yourself into the air with the help of your infinite supply of parachutes is just ridiculously entertaining and so fluid to control that you'll rarely ever want to travel about in any other way.  Seriously, the parachute hook-shot combo of transportation and quick escape NEVER gets old.There's a story but it really doesn't matter because the fun is in the willy-nilly combat and parachute mayhem.  As a bonus, *MAN* it looks good with great environmental lighting and color choices.  Lots and lots of fun, I guarantee.

Posted: November 27, 2015
												This game includes a grappling hook and a parachute. You can use a combination of the two to get practically anywhere on land in the game. You can skydive, grapple the ground (as soon as it's in range), and stand up like it was nothin'. You can pilot airliners, jets (if you can actually take off without dying), boats, boats with mounted guns, cars, cars with mounted guns, cars that are like tanks, actual tanks, helicopters, military helicopters with gatling guns, military helicopters with gatling guns and missiles, and stolen cop jeeps. Did I mention that the gatling guns and missile attachments on vehicles have infinite ammo? Did I mention that you can walk around with a gatling gun and be practically invincible because that also has infinite ammo?You can kill people by grappling them to the ground. You can go past locations and get chaos points for no damn reason. You can flip chasing cars by grappling them to the ground. You can play this game without a dedicated graphics card, but it'll be in slo-mo on low quality.So, if you like explosions, acting like Spider Man, ripping statue heads off with a helicopter, waiting 5 years to get to some place by parachuting off a mountain, and raining down infinite hell on military bases, this might be the game for you.While you're at it, go grab Just Cause 3; it's like 2, but with 10x everything *cough*infiniteC-4*cough*.

content:
Posted: December 26, 2013
												Just Cause 2 was a game I've looked into for a while, but never really thought about getting. Once it was sold for under $4 during a sale I had to give it a shot. This game was worth it, and I've sunk many hours into it quickly.Just Cause 2 really sticks next to it's name. Why? Just cause! Why else would you go into a millitary base, bombard it with a jet, dive bomb the plane into the raido tower and then drive a car off a cliff to give a horrific flash back when you rolled your car that one day.It really is a interesting experience, but the campains, either the main one or sides missions, are very repetative. The storyline is quite weak and is easily forgotten during the gameplay as you blow up more oil rigs.But the gameplay is what makes it worth purchasing. It's got an odd Grand Theft Auto: San Adreas feel to it. You know? The day you only have a half hour to kill beofre going to do something, so you load up the game to cause mass chaos and fear until you have to go. It's one of those games, and it does it quite well.Pros:Good gameplayDecent mechanicsNice graphics and aestheticMap size bigger than anything I've seen, even bigger than GTA VInteresting ways to use your grappling hookCons:Little money rewards and expensive weapons and vehiclesThe large map means that most places look the sameThe AI isn't very smartPlanes will explode when touching anything, even at speeds that you can out runMy rating 8/10, worth the purchase, at retail or sale price.

												What do you get when a developer puts less effort into writing a story, and more resources into great gameplay? content:
Posted: September 3, 2014
												I know I haven’t made one of these in a few weeks, but now that I am reinvigorated I can continue to push out this garbage you soak up like Honey Boo Boo’s mom soaks up pork chops. Just Cause 2 follows its predecessor, Half Life, with shrewd double meanings in the title. In this case it means a just cause as in a lame excuse to stick it to the man or the phrase ‘just because;’ a trivializing dismissal of all careless actions. For example, why grapple a soldier to a car and bum drag him through the suburban streets? Just cause. Now that you understand the title I’ll tell you what the game is about. It revolves around grappling a soldier to a car and bum dragging him through suburban streets. Experiencing sandbox games to their fullest potential is a skill I obviously lack. I have no idea why you’re trying to destabilize the government through chaos as you do in this game. Then again, asking a player to cause disorder in an open world game is like asking the office lunatic to steal your pens.Your character, Rico Rodriguez, is the physics defying godfather of both CJ and Niko Bellic in the sense that you can order cars on the black market or simply “find one” in the possession of a “generous” local, but most of the time you will be using the combination of the grappling hook and parachutes to get around. A feat only accomplishable by Rico himself which is where physics defying comes into play because parachutes seem to only be useful for forward momentum rather than actually slowing a fall. Instead you could simply pull yourself faster to the hard concrete floor using the grapple and somehow not become the next Red Sea. However, all of this is simply the chocolate cover of the Mars Bar waiting for you to see the tasty, gooey inside. Actually, who the hell am I kidding? The story takes place in only 7 missions so it is essentially non-existent.  So that ends that. Surprisingly, I’m not being paid by the Mars Bar company.

Posted: January 9, 2014
												Just Cause 2 is an action packed game with various islands and plenty of missions to be getting on with. It is set in a fictional place called Panau and has various islands like a city district, desert, mountains and a jungle. If your not the person who likes shooting things and blowing things up, you can do races which contain bikes, cars, planes and helicopters, but seriously who dosen't like destroying things here and there! There is a multiplayer mod which comes free with the game and this is fun to play with friends becasue you can sabatage your friends and kill them, blow things up and have infinate boost in vehicles and it's so easy to crash! Going back to the single player, the driving simulation is done very good in all vehicles and you can perform stunts on vehicles and watch the vehicle crash into the military! One of the best things about the game is the ability to have infinate parachute's and the ability to have a grapling hook. With the hook you can tether objects together, escape from the military, climb up walls, mountains etc and pull people off ledges and motor bikes! Overall I would give this game a 9 out of 10 becasue the stroy line is ok and there is so many things to do there is limitless fun and destruction!

												With South American flare and cheesy over-the-top puns, Just Cause 2 bursts onto the screen with all the James Bond-esque action and explosions imaginable. Playing as rogue assassin Rico Rodriguez, you fight your way across the fictional country of Panau, trying to take down an evil despot with the help of some of the most memorable characters to graze the screen. While ridiculously over the top, Just Cause 2 enhances virtually everything that made the first installment so much fun, with an amazing spectacle of explosions, beautiful vistas and ridiculously ludicrous stunts. Definitely bang for your buck.VERDICT: 9/10

Posted: December 31, 2014
												Just Cause 2 sports more style than substance.  But, that doesn't take away from the breathtaking open world of Panau.  Story wise is pretty much like the last game and is very forgettable, "Overthrow a corrupt Government by causing chaos in the region".  The main character "Rico" is a very generic action hero badass who is pretty much the equivilance of every 1980s action hero that creates the character.  I felt like the lack of character development and story is done on purpose because really, it's not all that important.  The reason however why most of the substance flaws are made up is because of how much effort Avalance Studious took their time to make the beautiful world as well as the masterfully executed gameplay mechanics this game has to offer including the infamous "grappling hook".  Overall, the story is not important but I recommend this game for the open world exploration, action, and many features of mass chaos.By the way if you don't already know, there is a bug that if you complete the full game of Just Cause 2, it will say 99.99%.  If this happens don't worry because this is only a minor bug and the developers are not supporting the game anymore because of Just Cause 3. Also, this game doesn't have mulitplayer, but there's a mod that someone created and is avalible on steam right now.

												I bought this game on the PC just as a frustration killer. I already have played it a lot on the 360 and it was selling for 5 bucks during the Black Friday sale and I thought, why not? Blow stuff up. That's literally what the game is about. Create as much chaos as possible and the game will reward you for it. To add to the fun, theres the grappling gun, inifinite parachutes, some interesting ways to control vehicles and HUGE open map to go crazy in. Its a formula that works flawlessly. This game is meant as a pressure valve;♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥at something or want to chill after a long day? Few things will help as much as this game; wanton destruction seems to appeal to just about anyone. Be warned though, it does have its flaws - the story and characters are a joke (though I sense the developers use it ironically, and taken in that context, they work pretty well!), the AI is thicker than an obese cinder block house and there are some minor control issues.Dont expect anything mind-blowing and/or contemplative in the story/character department - they are as bad as it gets - instead, play it for what it was made for - silly, mindless fun.

content:
Posted: April 5, 2016
												Just Cause 2 is a game that is packed full of fun and value, especially as it is often cheap in Steam sales.  The first thing I like is that it actually encourages you to cause chaos.  You earn chaos points for death and destruction caused to the army, buildings and vehicles of the regime that you are trying to destabilise.  There are plenty of weapons to cause this destruction and the grappling hook is a lot of fun.  Use it to climb about with or attach one end to an enemy, then attach the other to a vehicle, or a gas cannister, which you then puncture and watch them fly about then explode. Beyond the death and destruction, it is quite pretty and I was happy with the graphics.  The missions are fun and there are a ton of side activities that you can do if you fancy.  The map is quite large and there is a lot to explore, from little villages, jungle bases to sky scrapers and the big airport.  The addition of the free mulitplayer mod has some novelty, having no AI enemies, but lots to explore, cars, boats, planes  and weapons to play with and PVP if you fancy.  The airport seems to be the area where a lot of the PVP action and crashing passenger jets goes on.  Lots of fun and lots of value.

												Just Cause 2 is distilled fun. Plain and simple. Sure, the story may be lacking, the voice acting bad, and the things you can survive make absolutely no sense. content:
Posted: July 31, 2013
												Just Cause 2 is an amazing sandbox game. After the first two cheesily bad missions, you're dropped right smack in the center of Panau, a small totalitarian country of islands, with few guns or grenades and all cities occupied by the government. As you gain in strength, upgrading weapons, vehicles, and your health, you become stronger.      As you work with 3 different criminal factions, the government loses territory. There are 3 factions: The Roaches, a mafia of sorts with a leader who speaks in medical terms; the Reapers, Panau's own branch of the Communist Party; and the Ular Boys, strong traditionalists opposed to all foreign customs.           There are vehicles galore (though too many Tuk-Tuks and motor scooters) and lots of collectibles and destructibles. Much of the world is empty, but when you steal a tank and go on an explosive rampage, you tend not to notice these things. Overall, worth the price whether it's on sale or not.

												Just cause 2 is one of those games that doesn't need any recommendation, or word of mouth to tell the world how great a game it is!This sequel is the follow up to the 'Chaotic' open-world sandbox game - just cause, which was released back in 2006 for the Ps2, Xbox, and PC. What I love about just cause 2 is the fact you can free-roam an entire paradise island, with your main aim to cause as much chaos as possible to the open-world, so you can eventually topple the dictatorship in government.You can cause chaos by destroying military targets in much of the towns, cities, military bases, ports, and many more areas as possible. Because you play a mercenary named 'Rico', you get to play around with many cool 'boys toys' in just cause 2. The selection of helicopters, tanks, and guns to play around with in the game is immense.There's many fun easter eggs and secrets to find scattered around, with an island with much to do. So put down your current game, and join Rico on panau island.

content:
Posted: December 10, 2014
												Just Cause 2 is an open world blow'm-up simulator in the same vein as a Grand Theft Auto or Saint's Row; half the fun is messing with the physics of the world.The major success of Just Cause is that it gives players the tools to explore the world to its fullest extent. Your character's grappling hook is the most obvious of these, giving you the ability to traverse terrain at high speed, rope in enemies, or tie objects together. With a little imagination, it's the best thing since the Gravity Gun of Half Life 2... and both can be used to overturn vehicles!Furthermore, the protagonist is rather agile in his ability to manoever. While his ability to safely hop on top of a moving, swerving car makes little sense, it also makes him able to do fun things... like throwing delicious explosives at pursuers. He can ride anything, grab on to anything, and jump anywhere, and it results in a very liberating experience once you get the hang of 'the rules' of these manoevering abilities.As a car-jacking game, there are a TON of vehicles, and excuses to use them. Even when you acquire air travel and fast travel, there are many reasons why you'd use land vehicles; either they're more practical for quick getaways, have weapons attached, or you just want to ride on an occupied vehicle to keep your hands free to blow things up.There are only two minor downsides to this game. First, the story; it takes itself a bit too seriously for a game where you can tie someone to a jet as its taking off, and it doesn't relax its tone until the end. Second, this game lacks the ability for multiplayer - yes, there is an awesome multiplayer mod, but it's pure free-roam and without NPCs; the game proper does not support multiplayer when it feels like it should (having one player driving, another car-surfing, and another para-gliding would be an awesome way to make a getaway).However, these flaws are minor; the gameplay is satisfying, the world is gorgeous, and the price is right. Heck, the price may even be too low; Steam Sales have pitched this game as low as $2 when it is easily worth much more. Unless you really don't like gunplay and violence, this game is an absolute blast and recommended for anyone looking for some creative destruction.

content:
Posted: June 5, 2014
												Notice: Before you read this, note that this is just my opinion, and you can make your own. I won't affect it.       Shoot the dang enemies.... Hook onto Kane's heli... Run like hell.... GO GO GO! Oh, hello there. I'm going to start with the basics. For anyone who loves GTA, but doesn't play it often, or it broke, or whatever, Just Cause 2 is there. At it's price, you can't beat a realistic game like this. Sorry, GTA, but JC2 is better in my opinion. In this game you play as a character named Rico, who has many missions to do with various clients. It's not the same and the same every freaking round and mission. Each mission has its own meaning, solution, cause, ect. I played the demo multiple times and waited months to finally get enough money to pay for this. This game is something else. Each structure blows up its own way. Also, pull enemies off of feet with grapple hook, 5000 out of 1000Anyway, this game is unique for its grappling hook system. You can tether things together, pull things toward you, slap people with it, hook onto cars, drag bodies, tie two bodies together to make them slam in midair. This game is different for the colorful, but dark environment of the destructive missions, a few with multiple ways of solving them. There are amazing missions, but it still has its share of amazing free roam action. If you get into the right place, you can mess around with the environment. There is a variety of different weapons and vehicles, ranging from jeeps or pistols, to helicopters and explosives. There are quite a fair bit of special things to destroy that are found randomly around the map, many achievements, and other things to make this game quite an amazing one. If I could rate on a scale of 1-10 of everything, here's my list:Gameplay: 8.5 - It's good but can get fairly confusingGraphics: 9.0 - They are amazing and colorful, but if you have an old computer, you will lag quite a bit.Destruction System: 9.5 - It is amazing. I am a rather large fan of destruction myself. I find as many games with realistic damage systems as I can. There are few. Ones like this, Battlefield, and all those others fulfill that want. Vehicles: 8.0 - There are many to choose from, and you can hijack them, shoot the people out, blow the vehicle straight out of the road, and more. It has a realistic driving system as well.Weapons: 9.5 - Now here's the good stuff. There is a crapton of weapons to choose from, whether it be modded or put in the game on the start. There are SMGs, MGs, LMGs, Rockets, Pistols, and other things too.The way it is unique is the grappling hook. You don't see many games with those, do you? I give the grappling hook a 9.5 out of 10. Why not a full 10? It can be tricky to use sometimes, with a partially screwed up range. I feel it is a bit too short of a range. It is fun to use however, as it has multiple funny uses. For example, pulling people off of their feet and them saying "HELP! HE CAUGHT ME WITH HIS WIRE THINGY!" and them trying to untie it, but utterly failing, and launching into the air where you can shoot them. Another is tying them to a civillian car, and the civillian in the car having not the slightest idea there is a person they are dragging around, and killing the hitchhiker slowly.AI: 6.5 - Why? The AI has a ridiculous amount of health, but nothing like the super aim sniper noob AI in Sniper Elite V2. This AI is smart, can detect at a reasonable skill level, and other things, but it feels a bit overpowered with its health.Mods: (Unrated currently) - I haven't really modded it yet, only really the multiplayer mod, but I can easily imagine I'd love the mods.Multiplayer: (Unrated Currently) - I have only one friend to play with on it, and I haven't done it yet. I can imagine there'd be a few unimaginably good players out there, but a few not so good average players out there. Others are in between. Don't get me wrong, I can imagine I'd enjoy multiplayer apart from the fact I SUCK AT FPS AND TPS!FINALLY, THE MOMENT YOU'VE (maybe) BEEN WAITING FOR,My overall game rating and whether or not I recommend it, 9.5 out of 10 scorpions. Yes, I know. I had so many positive things to say about it, but like any other game, it has its negative parts, and I will list those after this rating. This game is a unique third person shooter, but its AI isn't that good. I mean come on, they are social butterflies who scream a lot and are way too, um, They have way too much health. Let's just say that. I can land 3 headshots and they simply wont die. I can shoot them in the chest, or any other vitals multiple times, and they're all like "NOP EIM FYN HEEHEETEE"(Translate from Panauan) (Nope, I'm fine TeeHeeHee)THE NEGATIVE SIDE:Like I mentioned multiple times, it is a very laggy game for those older and weaker CPUs, and it takes up a lot of space. It works, but imagine... It could be a crapton better on old computers, but NOOOOOAnd I mentioned this single thing twice: The AI is buggy.Where to start with it. It IS a fairly good AI, but the health and voices are annoying to me. I feel like I can't even play a game without hearing that voice, and I got this game the same day I wrote this review (6/5/14) I mean, come on.The last two things about the negatives. Price, and Graphics.This game is worth paying, but I feel it costs a little too much for weaker computers. It's like adding a high price and slow speed for bad graphics cards (Wait, isn't that exactly what it is?) Anyway, maybe if they brought the price down to 10 dollars, then it would be more fair. I just don't find this price amazingly fair.FINALLY, Graphics: The graphics are good, don't get me wrong, but they just BARELY work on slow graphics cards. I have a slow card, and 75 percent of my deaths in the game are from lag spikes. Maybe make the graphics less "WHOA, THIS LAGS MY SLOW GRAPHICS CARD" and there would be even MORE buys.Overall, YES, I recommend this. It is awesome with all of the good things, but the graphics and price could be more fair for us steam (and Square Enix game) players. If you love a simple destruction sandbox with missions and a twist, look into this game and maybe even buy it. You won't regret it. Now, what are you doing reading this? GO BUY IT NOW!

												After playing for almost 70 hours, this game is enjoyable, with different things to do and objectives to complete other than just simply missions. For instance, the Race Challenges provide a decent challenge and reward the player with a decent reward. However, when looking at the game as a whole, there are some aspects that could have been better rounded off rather than just placed in the game, such as the item collection. With around two thousand collectible items in the game, along with 360 different settlements for completion, make trying to complete this game a monotonous task. In addition to the mundane grind for game completion, the story isn't all that great. All in all, this game satisfies those that want more fast-paced action than substance in the giant, yet somehow empty, open-world environment that is Just Cause 2.

content:
Posted: November 8, 2015
												The following review is pretty lengthy. It's up to you whether or not to read it.Just Cause 2 at its core is the epitome of open-world freedom. The world is fairly saturated with color, from the lush green trees of the jungle, to the rich brown jungle trails, to the tan and orange deserts, to the pure blue water. It is by no means the most gorgeous game out there, but personally, I have respect for the art-like, cartoonish style.STORYI would say that JC2 doesn't try to take itself seriously, but that wouldn't be the complete truth. The story, while not the greatest ever, does take itself seriously, with a few generic characters such as:-The Patriotic, bacon-eating American-The super attractive, blonde, American Bad-A** soldier-The skin-tight suit-wearing, heavy-accented, incredibly intelligent Asian operativeAnd a few more! The story itself is... Well, It's no "The Last of Us", that's for sure. However, that's okay! The objectives and goals you actually get in the Agency Missions are a ton of fun for most of the time! There are also multiple "gangs" or "crime lords" you can do work for, in order to expand their influence over the country of Panau. The missions these gang leaders give out can also be very fun at times, however, the stronghold takeovers can get a little old. They essentially go like this: -Escort a squad of gang members through a military compound. Use a grapple hook to get over the gate, in order to open it from the other side, thus letting your allies in.-Keep the hacker alive at all costs-Defend the hacker while he hacks some sort of system-And finally, kill the stronghold commander to complete the stronghold takeover.As gamers, we all know that escort missions can be a huge pain in the rear, however, I've had no trouble whatsoever with these missions. What is the point of these stronghold takeovers, you ask?Well, if you are killed in action in free roam, you will respawn back at the nearest stronghold, ready to get right back into the action!CHAOSBack on the subject of missions, the way in which you actually gain access to these Agency Missions and Stronghold Takeovers is simple: BLOW S**T UP! Chaos is what fuels missions! By weakening the military government in free roam by assaulting bases, destroying fuel lines, destroying military vehicles, killing military personelle, overloading nuclear reactors, (etc.) you are not only having a blast by playing the game, but you're also progressing the story! I personally have not seen this replicated in any other game, and I find it to be an effective and fun way of progressing the storyline.GAMEPLAYTo keep it pretty simple, you're equipped with a grappling hook. An incredibly useful tool, the grappling hook can be used to climb buildings and mountains, attach to vehicles, link two objects together [and more, if you download the mod that lets you tether multiple things together], pull enemies off of high areas, gain momentum while parachuting, and even more. Have fun experimenting with the possibilities! I sure have!As you cause more Chaos, you gain more items to purchase in the black market. You can call the black market dealer using a beacon, and when he arrives, you have three options:-Buy a certain weapon / grenade-Buy a vehicle-Extract to any previously discovered location on the mapThe more Chaos you cause, the more options you will have available to you. You can also call the black market dealer during missions should you ever find yourself low on ammunition, or just needing a new toy.You can also find vehicle parts, weapon parts, and armor parts. Vehicle and weapon parts can be used in the black market screen to upgrade weapons and vehicles, to do things such as increase damage or increase top speed. As for armor parts, for every five you collect, you gain a health increase. OTHER NOTABLE PROS, AND CONS-Almost cringey voice acting among the natives. Incredibly exaggerated accents, and once I caught a female NPC misreading a line and then correcting herself. If bad voice acting is a dealbreaker, watch some gameplay on YouTube to see if you can bear it+Vehicles, helicopters most notably, being destroyed are much more realistic than in other games. (Minor detail)+Explosions have a satisfying sound (Minor detail)+Rico's animation for detonating C4, followed by the sight and sound of explosion, makes you feel like a total bad-a**+World size is MASSIVE, and I hear one of the islands is similar to the island from the TV Program "Lost".-Some key bindings are better off in different areas. I always change my key bindings in games as soon as I play them to make sure I'm comfortable, but I recommend anyone should change the defaults to what they see fit.-Weapon damage model for SOME weapons is a bit low. Unrealistically low. An M4 could take someone down in one bullet in reality of course, and this game is not reality, and frankly, this game is basically telling you "I'm NOT realistic AT ALL, and that's the point of the game!" However, if it was a bit quicker to kill an enemy, it would be welcomed. (MIGHT be fixed by upgrading weapons)-No indication of a kill on an enemy. Occasionally, a bullet will knock an enemy to the ground. Thinking they were dead, you turn to deal with a new target, only for the previous enemy to get right back up. A good way to make sure you've secured the kill is to watch and see if the enemy has dropped their weapon when they fell. While this works just fine, some kind of hitmarker would be welcomed. THE FINAL VERDICTJust Cause 2, while being a slightly older game, is an absolute blast to play. This game just literally lets you do whatever the hell you want. If you play Grand Theft Auto 5 in single player to have fun in the sandbox world, but dislike being killed so easily and want to just feel like a bad-a**, this game is your answer. (Note: Not once did I mention Grand Theft Auto 5 being a bad game, please do not get upset over nothing)I rate Just Cause 2 an 8.5 out of 10. SOME bad voice acting and story, but incredibly fun gameplay and world design to make up for it.

content:
Posted: September 3, 2014
												I know I haven’t made one of these in a few weeks, but now that I am reinvigorated I can continue to push out this garbage you soak up like Honey Boo Boo’s mom soaks up pork chops. Just Cause 2 follows its predecessor, Half Life, with shrewd double meanings in the title. In this case it means a just cause as in a lame excuse to stick it to the man or the phrase ‘just because;’ a trivializing dismissal of all careless actions. For example, why grapple a soldier to a car and bum drag him through the suburban streets? Just cause. Now that you understand the title I’ll tell you what the game is about. It revolves around grappling a soldier to a car and bum dragging him through suburban streets. Experiencing sandbox games to their fullest potential is a skill I obviously lack. I have no idea why you’re trying to destabilize the government through chaos as you do in this game. Then again, asking a player to cause disorder in an open world game is like asking the office lunatic to steal your pens.Your character, Rico Rodriguez, is the physics defying godfather of both CJ and Niko Bellic in the sense that you can order cars on the black market or simply “find one” in the possession of a “generous” local, but most of the time you will be using the combination of the grappling hook and parachutes to get around. A feat only accomplishable by Rico himself which is where physics defying comes into play because parachutes seem to only be useful for forward momentum rather than actually slowing a fall. Instead you could simply pull yourself faster to the hard concrete floor using the grapple and somehow not become the next Red Sea. However, all of this is simply the chocolate cover of the Mars Bar waiting for you to see the tasty, gooey inside. Actually, who the hell am I kidding? The story takes place in only 7 missions so it is essentially non-existent.  So that ends that. Surprisingly, I’m not being paid by the Mars Bar company.

content:
Posted: December 10, 2014
												Just Cause 2 is an open world blow'm-up simulator in the same vein as a Grand Theft Auto or Saint's Row; half the fun is messing with the physics of the world.The major success of Just Cause is that it gives players the tools to explore the world to its fullest extent. Your character's grappling hook is the most obvious of these, giving you the ability to traverse terrain at high speed, rope in enemies, or tie objects together. With a little imagination, it's the best thing since the Gravity Gun of Half Life 2... and both can be used to overturn vehicles!Furthermore, the protagonist is rather agile in his ability to manoever. While his ability to safely hop on top of a moving, swerving car makes little sense, it also makes him able to do fun things... like throwing delicious explosives at pursuers. He can ride anything, grab on to anything, and jump anywhere, and it results in a very liberating experience once you get the hang of 'the rules' of these manoevering abilities.As a car-jacking game, there are a TON of vehicles, and excuses to use them. Even when you acquire air travel and fast travel, there are many reasons why you'd use land vehicles; either they're more practical for quick getaways, have weapons attached, or you just want to ride on an occupied vehicle to keep your hands free to blow things up.There are only two minor downsides to this game. First, the story; it takes itself a bit too seriously for a game where you can tie someone to a jet as its taking off, and it doesn't relax its tone until the end. Second, this game lacks the ability for multiplayer - yes, there is an awesome multiplayer mod, but it's pure free-roam and without NPCs; the game proper does not support multiplayer when it feels like it should (having one player driving, another car-surfing, and another para-gliding would be an awesome way to make a getaway).However, these flaws are minor; the gameplay is satisfying, the world is gorgeous, and the price is right. Heck, the price may even be too low; Steam Sales have pitched this game as low as $2 when it is easily worth much more. Unless you really don't like gunplay and violence, this game is an absolute blast and recommended for anyone looking for some creative destruction.

												TLDR? Just buy it and see for yourself. 10/10It is truly sinful that I waited until now to play this game. While the story is laughable, it really sets the stage for what this game is all about: grappling hooks and parachutes. I've been an advocate for strong storylines and atmosphere in games for years now, but this game alone has really reminded me of what it feels like to play a game purely for fun. To further sweeten the pot, this game has aged really well.Pros:-MASSIVE open world that lets you do everything from deepsea dive to skydive. No place is off limits right from the start.-A wealth of vehicles, allowing you numerous options for transportation.-Diverse environments including deserts, jungles, cities, oceans, and snowy mountain ranges.-Various weapons, including miniguns with infinite ammo for over-the-top rambo vs. helicopter scenes.-The best grappling hook I've ever used in a game. -Playable on lower-end machines. I am experiencing zero lag on my Asus with GeForce GTX 560M with 8gb ram. Cons:-Poor optimization. Expect bugs and the possibility of a little extra work to get this game running smoothly. (This was especially true with my Nvidia graphics card)-Forgettable story. While some of the characters are interesting, there wont be much to hold your attention here. -Initially confusing mechanics. It may take a little while to get acclimated to moving around with the hook and chute.Overall, this is a suprisingly fun experience that will easily consume countless hours of your time if you let it. For me, it's a wonderful way to decompress after a full day of work. 10 grappling hooks out of 10

content:
Posted: June 5, 2014
												Notice: Before you read this, note that this is just my opinion, and you can make your own. I won't affect it.       Shoot the dang enemies.... Hook onto Kane's heli... Run like hell.... GO GO GO! Oh, hello there. I'm going to start with the basics. For anyone who loves GTA, but doesn't play it often, or it broke, or whatever, Just Cause 2 is there. At it's price, you can't beat a realistic game like this. Sorry, GTA, but JC2 is better in my opinion. In this game you play as a character named Rico, who has many missions to do with various clients. It's not the same and the same every freaking round and mission. Each mission has its own meaning, solution, cause, ect. I played the demo multiple times and waited months to finally get enough money to pay for this. This game is something else. Each structure blows up its own way. Also, pull enemies off of feet with grapple hook, 5000 out of 1000Anyway, this game is unique for its grappling hook system. You can tether things together, pull things toward you, slap people with it, hook onto cars, drag bodies, tie two bodies together to make them slam in midair. This game is different for the colorful, but dark environment of the destructive missions, a few with multiple ways of solving them. There are amazing missions, but it still has its share of amazing free roam action. If you get into the right place, you can mess around with the environment. There is a variety of different weapons and vehicles, ranging from jeeps or pistols, to helicopters and explosives. There are quite a fair bit of special things to destroy that are found randomly around the map, many achievements, and other things to make this game quite an amazing one. If I could rate on a scale of 1-10 of everything, here's my list:Gameplay: 8.5 - It's good but can get fairly confusingGraphics: 9.0 - They are amazing and colorful, but if you have an old computer, you will lag quite a bit.Destruction System: 9.5 - It is amazing. I am a rather large fan of destruction myself. I find as many games with realistic damage systems as I can. There are few. Ones like this, Battlefield, and all those others fulfill that want. Vehicles: 8.0 - There are many to choose from, and you can hijack them, shoot the people out, blow the vehicle straight out of the road, and more. It has a realistic driving system as well.Weapons: 9.5 - Now here's the good stuff. There is a crapton of weapons to choose from, whether it be modded or put in the game on the start. There are SMGs, MGs, LMGs, Rockets, Pistols, and other things too.The way it is unique is the grappling hook. You don't see many games with those, do you? I give the grappling hook a 9.5 out of 10. Why not a full 10? It can be tricky to use sometimes, with a partially screwed up range. I feel it is a bit too short of a range. It is fun to use however, as it has multiple funny uses. For example, pulling people off of their feet and them saying "HELP! HE CAUGHT ME WITH HIS WIRE THINGY!" and them trying to untie it, but utterly failing, and launching into the air where you can shoot them. Another is tying them to a civillian car, and the civillian in the car having not the slightest idea there is a person they are dragging around, and killing the hitchhiker slowly.AI: 6.5 - Why? The AI has a ridiculous amount of health, but nothing like the super aim sniper noob AI in Sniper Elite V2. This AI is smart, can detect at a reasonable skill level, and other things, but it feels a bit overpowered with its health.Mods: (Unrated currently) - I haven't really modded it yet, only really the multiplayer mod, but I can easily imagine I'd love the mods.Multiplayer: (Unrated Currently) - I have only one friend to play with on it, and I haven't done it yet. I can imagine there'd be a few unimaginably good players out there, but a few not so good average players out there. Others are in between. Don't get me wrong, I can imagine I'd enjoy multiplayer apart from the fact I SUCK AT FPS AND TPS!FINALLY, THE MOMENT YOU'VE (maybe) BEEN WAITING FOR,My overall game rating and whether or not I recommend it, 9.5 out of 10 scorpions. Yes, I know. I had so many positive things to say about it, but like any other game, it has its negative parts, and I will list those after this rating. This game is a unique third person shooter, but its AI isn't that good. I mean come on, they are social butterflies who scream a lot and are way too, um, They have way too much health. Let's just say that. I can land 3 headshots and they simply wont die. I can shoot them in the chest, or any other vitals multiple times, and they're all like "NOP EIM FYN HEEHEETEE"(Translate from Panauan) (Nope, I'm fine TeeHeeHee)THE NEGATIVE SIDE:Like I mentioned multiple times, it is a very laggy game for those older and weaker CPUs, and it takes up a lot of space. It works, but imagine... It could be a crapton better on old computers, but NOOOOOAnd I mentioned this single thing twice: The AI is buggy.Where to start with it. It IS a fairly good AI, but the health and voices are annoying to me. I feel like I can't even play a game without hearing that voice, and I got this game the same day I wrote this review (6/5/14) I mean, come on.The last two things about the negatives. Price, and Graphics.This game is worth paying, but I feel it costs a little too much for weaker computers. It's like adding a high price and slow speed for bad graphics cards (Wait, isn't that exactly what it is?) Anyway, maybe if they brought the price down to 10 dollars, then it would be more fair. I just don't find this price amazingly fair.FINALLY, Graphics: The graphics are good, don't get me wrong, but they just BARELY work on slow graphics cards. I have a slow card, and 75 percent of my deaths in the game are from lag spikes. Maybe make the graphics less "WHOA, THIS LAGS MY SLOW GRAPHICS CARD" and there would be even MORE buys.Overall, YES, I recommend this. It is awesome with all of the good things, but the graphics and price could be more fair for us steam (and Square Enix game) players. If you love a simple destruction sandbox with missions and a twist, look into this game and maybe even buy it. You won't regret it. Now, what are you doing reading this? GO BUY IT NOW!

content:
Posted: November 18, 2014
												Just Cause 2 is essentially an action movie where you create and participate in the set-pieces. Your jaw will drop at the amazing things you can and will do here – either intentionally or unintentionally. The game's open world environment allows you to really make your own game out of this; to use the weapons and vehicles you want to use and to do the things you want to do. Admittedly the game does have a few flaws that would likely break a lesser game, such as the ridiculous saving and spawning system and your inability to go inside many buildings (things I certainly hope are fixed in the recently announced Just Cause 3), but Just Cause 2 is not a lesser game and still manages to be endlessly entertaining despite them. With a great modding community to boot, Just Cause 2 is absolutely worth picking up, either at full price or during one of its frequent sales. It isn't Shakespeare, but it embraces and relishes in that fact. And if you like the gameplay of Just Cause 2 but wish you could throw topical insults at strangers while playing, check out the free Multiplayer Mod, which is basically to Just Cause 2 as Garry's Mod is to Half-Life 2.

												Interested in open world kind of games? Just Cause II has an amazing and really huge world begging to be explored. Here I was thinking about how big the GTA or Far Cry 2 worlds are; well, let me tell you they are tiny compared to the Panau Island (the place were Just Cause II story/events takes place). content:
Posted: July 30, 2012
												Similar in concept to GTA, but far superior in many ways. The world is 400 SQUARE MILES of fully-explorable terrain, including multiple islands and the expanses of water in between. There are air and water vehicles in addition to cars. Your grappling hook basically turns you into Spider-Man. There's so much stuff to blow up (as part of the story, no less!). Impromptu car chases with the military are amazing, especially since the soldiers are hilariously incompetent drivers - count how many of their own they mow down while chasing you down the road!The downsides are that weapons are limited to less than a dozen generic guns, and the missions are rather repetitive and sometimes menial. But who cares when the bulk of your time will be spent seeing which car makes the coolest explosion? The missions are almost a diversion in this do-anything-you-want world.An excellent stress-relief game. Highly recommended.

content:
Posted: May 12, 2015
												The NPC voices are terrible, the story is shallow, the vehicles are poorly tuned, the gunfights lack feedback, the goals are repetitive, and the DLC is too granular.And I love it to bits. This is a feel good game, standing out from a bottomless pit of soulless sandboxes with at best mean-spirited or insufficient premises. Ultimately that sums up why I love it: Rico has a just cause. And despite the obvious pun, he pursues it as a mostly well-meaning hero, not a chaotic blank slate. Never has wreaking unfettered havoc on an island paradise been so pleasantly justified. It also has the trappings of an action spy thriller, providing an appropriate thematic backdrop for the action and paying affectionate homage to the genre, but toning down the typical byzantine plot in favour of uninterrupted carnage and exploration.Even lacking polish in multiple areas, JC2 is conceptually superior to many similar titles. Much like the peerless Metroid Prime, it begins with a solid gameplay concept and builds a story around it, not vice versa. Unfortunately the plot is more or less a straight shot to the finale with few memorable twists or diversions, but on the other hand, it's harmless to the experience. Throughout the story and into the endless Mercenary Mode, Rico's personality and motivation is reinforced through small quips he dishes out in response to certain events. For instance, although there's no real punishment for harming civilians, once you hear Rico complain about "aiming for the other guy", you might prefer to avoid them. Happily, these quotes trigger sparingly and are still fresh after 100+ hours of gameplay.Here's hoping Avalanche Studios can create the perfect implementation of this formula in Just Cause 3. Until then, part deux remains a unique beast offering many hours of childish fun...and in deference to popular trends, EXPLOSIONS RAAAR SURVIVED A MILE HIGH BASE JUMP BY PULLING THE CORD A FEW FRAMES BEFORE HITTING CONCRETE 11/10 WOULD CONSOLE PORT AGAIN rico is mulatto-hispanic james bond maybe? woo ragdolls

Posted: December 13, 2013
												With over a hundred hours of gametime and completing everything in the game I still enjoy playing JC2. It's like an action movie you play with ridiculous stunts and enemy kills in a huge open world map. I'd say you could get 75+ hours out of the game from doing all the missions and destroying everything. After that the game has a thriving modding community with all kinds of crazy mods adding hours more of gameplay plus a multiplayer mod is upcoming which will aloow you to explore Panau with your friends. Everything is very good quality except for it occasionally crashes when I have many mods running but it is not major. I totally reccomend this game.

content:
Posted: April 26, 2012
												One of the manliest games ever released, Just Cause 2 is a playablesummer blockbuster by Michael Bay, but without the "being an insult to the medium" part.This is the only game where "listen here, jackass, if you want the story to progress, go blow♥♥♥♥♥♥up." is the modus operandi. But the story isn't this game's best feature, despite every single story mission trying to one-up the previous one.This game is a sandbox gift to mankind. You can drive any vehicle you run across, shoot any gun you run across and blow up anything that's remotely combustible. And you can go ANYWHERE.Alongside mostly believable physics (grappling hook not included in that regard) and gorgeous graphics, you get a package made with love and delivered by helicopter.Try playing other games now, you pipeline jerks!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 13, 2013
												Ever wanted to play an action movie? Look no further; this game has GTA-style free roaming, a ridiculous plot worthy of Mission: Impossible, and endless squads of incompetent mooks to gun down. Or hapless civilians, if that's your thing.Just Cause 2 is by no means a difficult game or a fantastic story, but that's hardly going to cross your mind as you cruise through gorgeous scenery and cause more explosions than a Michael Bay movie.It DOES get a bit repetitive by the end, but still loads and loads of fun, and at a great price too. Especially RIGHT NOW AT THE TIME OF THIS WRITING due to the Steam summer sale; at 80% off, you can grab it AND all the DLC for just under 5 dollars (US).
